page.title: 15Ecology(1)
page.content: Our Domesday area covers 12 square kilometres of South Herefordshire,a rural farming community,famous for its rich red soil.The soil was hard and crumbly because when we held it in our hands it would trickle through our fingers yet in the middle it was moist and sometimes you could squeeze it and it would be like clay.The stone was mostly sandstone.We could tell that because of the red colour and it was crumbly,you could easily break it with your hands. "Jack-by-the-hedge"and cow parsley were growing in the hedges.There were also a lot of trees and holly bushes growing in the hedges but apart from blackberries there were not many wild berries.We saw lots of birds'nests and snake and rabbit holes.The rabbits had made their holes at the end of the fields where the hedges are.
